alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 6:47AM EST until February 21 at 9:24AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River at Iroquois. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, County Road 1950N threatened north of Watseka. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will gradually rise above flood stage today and to 20.0 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 1145 PM CST this evening.
